intro: Schmaltzia duckerae, commonly known as the Duckerae schmaltzia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight aromatic scent. Schmaltzia duckerae is typically found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to withstand periods of drought.
